poem:
"Echoes of Gaza"

The sea breathes, restless beneath the indifferent moon,
Cries and whispers, in the tongues of east, unending. 
Ships carve a path through the sighs of Gaza,
Pirates of empathy, bearing naught but hope. 
Hours pass on land, in sky, beneath the sea,
Yet the clock halts in the human heart. 
In the echo of conflict, silence sounds greater. 
From Cyprus sails a single, trembling note.
